topic.title: alter disk-store
topic.shortdesc: Modify or remove a region from an offline disk-store.

body.p: When modifying a region's configuration, it is customary to take the region off-line and restart using the new configuration. You can use the alter disk-store command to change the configuration of the region stored in the disk-store to match the configuration you will use at restart.

The three required options, --name, --region, and --disk-dirs, identify the disk store and region to be altered. If no additional options are specified, gfsh displays the current configuration without making any changes.

row.entry: Name
Description
Required. Name of the disk-store whose contents will be altered.
Required. Name (including path) of the region using the disk store.
Required. Directories where the data for the disk store was previously written.
The fully-qualified class name of the compressor to use when compressing region entry values. A value of none removes the compressor.

An estimate of the maximum number of application threads that will concurrently access a region entry. Together with --initial-capacity and --load-factor, sets the parameters on the underlying java.util.ConcurrentHashMap used for storing region entries. This attribute does not apply to partitioned regions.
Enables statistics for the region. Valid values are true or false. If the parameter is specified without a value, the value of true is used.
Together with --concurrency-level and --load-factor, sets the parameters on the underlying java.util.ConcurrentHashMap used for storing region entries.

Together with --concurrency-level and --initial-capacity, sets the parameters on the underlying java.util.ConcurrentHashMap used for storing region entries. This must be a floating point number between 0 and 1, inclusive.

Action to take when evicting entries from the region. Valid values are:
none
overflow-to-disk
local-destroy

Least recently used eviction algorithm. Valid types are:
none
lru-entry-count
lru-heap-percentage
lru-memory-size
Number of entries allowed in the region before eviction occurs.
Specifies whether the region values are in heap memory or off-heap memory. When true, region values are in off-heap memory. If the parameter is specified without a value, the value of true is used.

Specifies whether to remove the region from the disk-store. If the parameter is specified without a value, the value of true is used. Note: --remove deletes all persistent data for the region. Consider copying the disk store files to a backup before using this option if you might want to retrieve the data at a later date.

topic.title: alter region
topic.shortdesc: Alters the configuration of a region.

body.p: Availability: Online. You must be connected in gfsh to a JMX Manager member to use this command.

row.entry: Name
Description
Default Value
IDs of the Async Event Queues that will be used for write-behind operations.
Fully qualified class name of a plug-in to be instantiated for receiving after-event notification of changes to the region and its entries. Any number of cache listeners can be configured.

Fully qualified class name of a plug-in to be instantiated for receiving notification of cache misses in the region. At most, one cache loader can be defined in each member for the region. For distributed regions, a cache loader may be invoked remotely from other members that have the region defined.

Fully qualified class name of a plug-in to be instantiated for receiving before-event notification of changes to the region and its entries. The plug-in may cancel the event. At most, one cache writer can be defined in each member for the region
Number of seconds before a region or an entry expires. Specify -1 to indicate that there is no expiration of this type
Number of seconds before a region or an entry expires. Specify -1 to indicate that there is no expiration of this type.
Maximum value for the Eviction Attributes that the eviction algorithm uses to determine when to perform its eviction action. The unit of the maximum value is determined by the Eviction Algorithm.
IDs of the Gateway Senders where data is routed.
Group(s) of members where the region will be altered.
Required. Name (including path) of the region.
Number of seconds before a region or an entry expires. If timeout is not specified, it defaults to zero (which means no expiration).

p.codeblock: gfsh>alter region --name=customer --eviction-max=5000 Member | Status ------- | ---------------------------------- server1 | Region "/customer" altered on "server1"

topic.title: alter runtime
topic.shortdesc: Alters configuration properties for all members or a subset of members while the member or members are running.

body.p: For more information on these configuration properties, see and configuration parameter reference.
Availability: Online. You must be connected in gfsh to a JMX Manager member to use this command.

row.entry: Name
Description
Default Value

Name or ID of the member whose configuration is to be altered at runtime. If you do not specify this parameter, the configuration properties are modified for all cluster members using the cluster configuration service.
If not specified, all members using the cluster configuration service

Name of the group whose members's runtime configuration is to be altered. If you do not specify this parameter, the configuration properties are modified for all cluster members using the cluster configuration service.
If not specified, all members using the cluster configuration service

Archive disk space limit. Maximum size (in megabytes) of all inactive statistic archive files combined. If this limit is exceeded, inactive archive files are deleted, oldest first, until the total size is within the limit. If set to zero, disk space use is unlimited. Valid values are (in megabytes): 0 - 1000000.

Archive file size limit. The maximum size (in megabytes) of a single statistic archive file. Once this limit is exceeded, a new statistic archive file is created, and the current archive file becomes inactive. If set to zero, file size is unlimited. Valid values are (in megabytes): 0 - 1000000.

Log disk space limit. Maximum size in megabytes of all inactive log files combined. If this limit is exceeded, inactive log files are deleted, oldest first, until the total size is within the limit. If set to zero, disk space use is unlimited. Valid values are (in megabytes): 0 - 1000000.

Log file size limit. Maximum size in megabytes of a log file before it is closed and logging rolls on to a new (child) log file. If set to zero, log rolling is disabled. Valid values are (in megabytes): 0 - 1000000.

Log level. Valid values are:
none
error

config
warning
severe
fine
finer
finest
config
